content: Heraclitus’ Fragment 72 names humans and their “departure from being (Abkommen vom Sein)” (cf. Being and Time), designates a fall upon/away/from beings (Verfall oder Ab-fall [an das Seinde]) > this fall belongs to Difference (Unterschied) btwn Being/beings, so that Fall of Man sets aside [obscures] this difference > for Heraclitus, the foreign depart from difference [not as antagonistically (feindlich) disposed toward foreign (Fremden) as Plato]

content: xynon means same as koinon? > for Heraclitus, xynienai: going together; koinon merely katholon, the universal, i.e. “what belongs equally to all despite differences” [a going together that’s not the universal common] > co-belonging of xynon is differing (verschieden) (to diapheromenon), this alone can bring together (zusammenbringen): no night alone, no day alone, co-belonging of day/night (their very being) [not dialectic?]

content: Hegel: “a torn sock is better then a mended one…” > to understand (Verstehen), must see (sehen) phenomenologically, invitation to phenomenological “kindergarten”: to tear apart (Zer-reissen), to tear in 2 parts, to separate, make 2 out of 1: torn sock no longer present-at-hand [sock appears outside its usage, w/ more force (Kraft)] > diese Einheit [the unity of the whole sock] ist im Zerrissensein [being-torn] als verlorene [lost] Einheit gegenwärtig

content: reading Hegel’s “dichotomy (Entzweiung) is the source of the need for philosophy” [Differenz…], Heidegger states that all attempts to suppress “tearing” must be abandoned, “tearing” im Grunde remains and must remain: “in the tearing…there always reigns (waltet) unity or a necessary conjoining (Vereinigung) that is, a living unity”

content: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation

content: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element

content: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

content: what sort of positing is that by which Absolute appears for consciousness? > in Greek, positing is thesis, apothēkē means same as apophansis, let matter stand here from itself, as it is, i.e. presences (anwest) > modern positing, however, is closest to Latin repraesentatio, the re- refers back to ego cogito, re- as “back to me,” thus that which stands becomes object (all this covered over by presumptions of idealism)

content: Heidegger speaks of something inappropriate in formulation of “meaning of being,” possible to interpret “project” as a human performance, project only as structure of subjectivity (this is how Sartre reads it) > Heidegger countered this mistake w/ “truth of being,” still retaining meaning of project as opening disclosure (Erschliessung), and to assure that truth wasn’t confused w/ correctness, Heidegger explained it by “location (Ortschaft) of being,” which presupposes understanding of Ortseins des Ortes (place-being of place), hence Topologie des Seyns

content: Sein: Nichts: Selbes? > essence of metaphysics: nothing metaphysical [overcoming metaphysics] > Heidegger’s word neither on side of beings, nor simply on that of being: speaks from where horizon of difference (Differenz) becomes visible: ontological difference as condition of possibility (Bedingung der Möglichkeit) for metaphysics [differance] > Heideggerian proposition (Aussage): is difference itself, speaks of difference w/out holding onto it, thus he has abandoned (verlassen) metaphysics

content: Heidegger’s question “Why are there beings/not nothing?” doesn’t seek 1st cause [like Leibniz? Schelling?], seeks to come out of forgetfulness of Being > his question authentically says: “how does it come about that you concern yourself so much w/ beings and so little w/ being?”

content: nothing in Heidegger not negative, is a nihilating nothing (nichtendes Nichts), its essence turns away from beings: “nothing in its nihilation refers to the being in its manifestation (Offenbarkeit),” “the nihilation (Nichten) of the nothing “is” being” [cf. 58 nihilating nothing as forgetfulness, beings pressing into foreground?]

content: nihilating nothing decrees “fall upon beings” [?] > fall (Verfall) not as falling away from (Abfallen von), but as ontological/natural condition of Dasein (Being and Time not leading everyday Dasein to thematization of Being)

content: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]

content: “Time and Being” thought “letting” as “giving (Geben)” > giving speaks in Es gibt (il y a too ontic of a translation, refers to presence of beings) > too ontic to understand Es Gibt as letting come to presence, as if it means “to make present” > rather think Es gibt re: letting itself, presence no longer emphasized: “to let the presencing (Lassen das Anwesen)” [still presence there?] (presence of a being no long draws one’s attention but ground the being covers over to stand independent) > letting as gift (Gabe), gives only its gift, withdraws/holds back (verbirgt)

content: when attention is drawn to the presencing (das Anwesen) of “letting-be,” this interpretation that of metaphysics [doesn’t Heidegger interpret as such in Anaximander?] > in emphasis (Betonung) on presencing, a 3rd has its place (Ort), the stress (Ton) now on letting itself, that which allows (lässt) (releases [entlässt]?) presencing, allows Being, the epochē of Being: one stands before being as being, not a form (Gestalten) of its destiny [so close to Hegel] > in emphasis to let presencing, no longer room for name Being, letting is pure giving, the it (das Es) that gives, Ereignis [beyond Being]

content: no destinal (geschickliche) epoch of Ereignis: sending is from enowning (Das Schicken ist aus dem Ereignen) > return to Greeks only has meaning as a return to Being [?] > “step back (Schritt züruck)” (step that retreats [züruckgeht] from metaphysics [overcoming metaphysics]) has sole meaning of enabling (ermöglichen) glance ahead (Vorausblick) to what comes (was kommt) [to-come], thinking begins anew: in essence of technology thought catches sight of heralding portent (verdeckenden Vor-Schein), die verbergende Vor-Erscheinung des Ereignisses selbst

content: as technology unfolds objectivity (Gegenständlichkeit) (as a manner of sending) transforms more into standing reservedness (Beständlichkeit) > no longer objects today only standing reserves (beings held in readiness for being consumed [Verbrauchtwerden]), no longer substances but subsistances > energy politics, politics of agriculture: systematic ordering of space w/in general planning, directed toward future exploitation (Ausbeutung), everything arranged in horizon of utility: orderability (Bestellbarkeit) [better than Beherrschung] of what is to be seized > for example: forest as “greenspace” (stock, supply, means)

content: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)

content: for Husserl, substantiality [categorial?], non-appearance, (of book), enables what appears to appear, more apparent that what itself appears > w/ categorial intution, Husserl freed being from its attachment to judgment reorients entire field of investigation > if Heidegger poses question of meaning of being, must already be beyond being, understood as being of beings [Befragte: Being; das Erfragte: meaning of Being]

content: subjectivity itself not questioned re: its being > since Descartes, subjectivity is fundamentum inconcussum, the barrier to unfolding Seinsfrage ——the “making-present-to-oneself (Selbstvergegenwärtigung)” of consciousness takes place in immanence, what I am conscious of is present to me, in my consciousness > in Being and Time, “thing” no longer in consciousness, but in the world > despite intentionality, Husserl remains trapped in immanence: Husserl retrieves proper consistency of object, saves object, but by situating it in immanence of consciousness

content: when Heidegger looks at inkwell, does so w/out reference to hyletic data and categories, he undergoes fundamental experience w/ thing itself [outside consciousness but still moral image of thought?] > “being” in Da-sein says being-outside-of [vs. being in of consciousness], must preserve an “outside,” thus ek-stasis > Dasein rigorously means: ek-statically being there (immanence is broken) > from ek-stasis to instancy in the clearing (Inständigkeit in der Lichtung) [the turn?]

content: Marxism as a whole rests on this thesis [from Early Writings]: “to be radical is to grasp the root of the matter, but for man the root is man himself,” thinks on the basis of production: social production of society, self-production of human being as social being > Marxism is thought of today, where self-production of man & society prevail [isn’t Nietzsche & Hegel also thought of today?] > self-production (Selbstherstellung) raises danger (Gefahr) of self-destruction (Selbstzerstörung)

content: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]

content: surrender consciousness, join new domain (Bereich) of Dasein, must step into it, enter it, to stand in relation to what isn’t man > entry into this domain not produced by thought undertaken by Heidegger: to believe thinking capable of changing place of man, still conceive it (vorstellen) on model of production (Produktion); rather, thinking prepares man for possibility (Möglichkeit) of corresponding to such an entry (Einkehr) [so attention is delayed!]

content: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself

content: scholastic word objectum is translation of Greek word antikeimenon, but keisthai of antikeimenon means already lying before > whereas object, via representation, brought to halt in an “over and against (im Gegenüber)” > Greek experience of already lying before (and from itself) doesn’t require representation play role in positing being > Aristotle interprets phusis from poiēsis, bringing-forth into open—not modern notion of production (set into availability [Herstellen in die Verfügbarkeit])

content: Marx (like Feuerbach): “criticism of religion ends w/ teaching that man is the highest being for man” > Heidegger’s Marx interpretation not political, concerned w/ Being in manner it destines itself: w/ Marx, position of most extreme nihilism is reached [what about Nietzsche?] > if man is the highest being for man, Being (as Being) is nothing (nichts) (nihil) anymore for man > to understand Marx politically: make politics a mode of self-production (perfectly consistent w/ Marx’s thought) (Marx’s statement decidedly metaphysical)

content: there is a return to beginning in Being and Time, but it is through destruction, dismantling, disintegration (Auflösung) (which is sometimes awkward [ungeschickt] [?]) of what is destined as being in metaphysics > not yet in Being and Time a genuine knowledge of history of being, hence the awkwardness, naiveté of “ontological destruction” > since then, unavoidable naiveté of novice gave way to a knowing [he arrived, no more destruction?]

content: in Greek manner, einai means to presence (Greeks speak more revealingly (zeigender)/precisely than we do) [Heidegger’s bias?] > Parmenides’ esti gar einai, genuine tautology: names Same only once, as itself: [fragment 8] “the same dwelling in the same, it lies in itself” [cf. 80 verse is eukuklos, abundant/overflowing, says on its own complete tautology] > in domain of inapparent (Unscheinbaren): presencing itself presences (anwest Anwesen selbst): “great number of indications (Zeignisse) [marks? traces?]…”, indication as sēma, what shows & lets be seen

content: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks
